user_initial_prompt: build a backend for online bakery shop
tech_stack_summary: Web Development → Backend → REST → Java → Spring Boot → Tomcat

Core Application & Web Stacks -> Web Dev.rationale: Chosen for building user interfaces and handling HTTP requests for an online bakery shop.
Core Application & Web Stacks -> Web Dev.purpose: Enables creation of a functional backend that can handle interactions with users, manage orders, inventory and more.

Web Development -> Backend.rationale: Since the user requirement is to build a backend for an online bakery shop, the Backend option is necessary.
Web Development -> Backend.purpose: This option enables the development of server-side logic, database management, and API creation.

Backend -> REST.rationale: REST is a well-established and widely-adopted standard for APIs, making it easier to integrate with other systems and services.
Backend -> REST.purpose: Enables communication between the backend and various frontend applications using HTTP requests

REST -> Java.rationale: Java is widely used for building large-scale, enterprise-grade applications, which makes it suitable for this online bakery shop backend.
REST -> Java.purpose: Java enables development of robust, scalable and secure backends.

Java -> Spring Boot.rationale: Popularity, extensive community support, and a wide range of pre-built solutions make it an ideal choice for beginners.
Java -> Spring Boot.purpose: Enables fast and easy development of RESTful services in Java.

Spring Boot -> Tomcat.rationale: Tomcat is widely used and well-documented with Spring Boot, making it a stable option for this project.
Spring Boot -> Tomcat.purpose: Enables the deployment of the Spring Boot backend application.
